intro: Saprosma membranacea, commonly known as the membranous saprosma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the Rubiaceae family.
